sections.section_instructions:
Do the following statements agree with the information given in Reading Passage?

In boxes 1-5 on your answer sheet, write:

TRUE. if the statement agrees with the information
FALSE. if the statement contradicts the information
NOT GIVEN. If there is no information on this

questions.question_text: Brantingham and Beekman were the first researchers to investigate the relationship between health problems and flat floors.
The subjects in Fisher's control group experienced a decline in their physical condition.
The manufacturers are increasing the number of cobblestone mats they are making.
Fisher based his ideas on what he saw during an overseas trip.
The Masai Barefoot Technology shoes are made to fit people of all ages.

sections.section_instructions:
Choose the correct letter, A, B, C or D.

Write the correct letter in boxes 6-8 on your answer sheet.

questions.question_text: The writer suggests that Brantingham and Beekman's findings were

options.C: applicable to a narrow range of people.

questions.question_text: What claim is made by the designers of the cobblestone mats?

options.A: They need to be used continuously in order to have a lasting effect.
options.B: They would be as beneficial to younger people as to older people.
options.C: They could be an effective alternative to medical intervention.
options.D: Their effects may vary depending on individual users.

questions.question_text: Which of the following points does the writer make in the final paragraph?

options.A: People should question new theories that scientists put forward.
options.B: High prices do not necessarily equate to a quality product.
options.C: People are setting up home in the country for health reasons.
options.D: The natural environment is fast disappearing.

sections.section_instructions:
Complete the summary below.

Choose ONE WORD ONLY from the passage for each answer.

Write your answers in boxes 9-14 on your answer sheet.

content.paragraph:
In their research, Brantingham and Beekman looked at the complex physical {9} of the foot and noted that the surfaces of modern environments restrict its movement. They invented a mat which they tried out on factory workers. Whenever the workers walked on it, the different levels of {10} in the mat would encourage greater muscle action. In turn, this lessened the effect of {11} on the cardiovascular system.

Similar research was undertaken by John Fisher and colleagues in Oregon. As a result of their findings, they decided to market cobblestone mats to the elderly as a means of dealing with {12}.

Reflexologists claim that by manipulating specific parts of the feet, the performance of certain {13} will also improve. Finally, Benno Nigg at Calgary University believes that specially shaped {14} on shoes should give health benefits.
